text: ISSUE: While working outdoors, it is impossible to see the the mouse while in code editor. The code editor bg is black and so is the cursor, mouse pointer.
Adrian are you on a Mac? If so we have a fix for this coming in the HubSpot Developer Google Chrome extension

The fix for the mac cursor issue will be coming in an update to the plugin within the next week or so.  but you can get the fix early by going to the github, click download zip, then follow the directions in the readme starting at step 3.
<https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension>

Otherwise you could install the extension from the chrome store(link in the readme) and just wait until the update is released
I’m suddenly getting this error: ```TemplateSyntaxException: Cannot coerce '[10]' of class com.HubSpot.jinjava.objects.collections.PyList to class java.lang.Double (incompatible type)```
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FBNG915J7/screen_shot_2018-07-11_at_8.58.51_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-07-11 at 8.58.51 AM.png>
what is it returning when you don’t have the /100?
But it was working before which is strange
i've installed it a while back, but haven't tried it yet, but soon

I will make a push to try to get the next update out quicker because the cursor issue is definitely an annoying issue and will help a lot of developers.

I just want to make sure the rest of that update is ore thoroughly tested, there are a lot of big changes to it coming, and while they’re exciting I don’t want to release them if they’re buggy.
I can not remove an icon once selected in a custom module icon selector
<@U38EZFVFE> I’ve started looking into the issue, thank you for pointing it out!
I was having that problem with a number field yesterday too. Solved it the same way. It seemed to work okay in the live preview, the editor just wasn't parsing it right or something.
